Article.Abstract: The immunological activities of five synthetic peptides of the prM protein of dengue-2 (DEN-2) virus containing B cell epitopes were evaluated in BALB/c mice. Two peptides elicited neutralizing antibodies against all four DEN serotypes. Virus-specific proliferative responses were demonstrated in mice immunized with four of the five peptides, demonstrating the presence of T cell epitopes. Mice immunized with three of the five peptides conjugated with bovine albumin showed statistically significant levels (P<0.05) of protection when challenged with DEN-2 virus. These results could constitute the basis for the establishment of the role of DEN virus pre and M antigens in the development of anti-flaviviral vaccines.
Article.ArticleTitle: Immune response to synthetic peptides of dengue prM protein.
Article.Affiliations: Virology Department, "Pedro Kouri" Tropical Medicine Institute, Autopista Novia del Mediodia, km 6, P.O. Box Marianao 13, Havana, Cuba. svazquez@ipk.sld.cu.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: An internal source is provided because the sequence does not match those currently in genebank/swiss-prot databases.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to prevent or reduce disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were given four injections, each 15 days apart.
Mice were given four injections, each 15 days apart.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Antibody titers in mice immunized with Bovine Serum Albumin-conjugated peptide were substantially higher.

Hyperimmune ascites fluids against Dengue virus were assayed for peptide recognition. Similar but weaker responses were shown with hyperimmune ascites fluids against Dengue virus-1 (Hawaii), Dengue virus-3 (H-87), and Dengue virus-4 (H-241).

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were given four injections, each 15 days apart.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Antibody titers in mice immunized with free peptide were substantially lower, but readily detectable.
